definitions.definition: To surrender on stipulated terms, end all resistance , give up , go along with or comply .
examples: He argued and hollered for so long that I finally capitulated just to make him stop.
definitions.label_groups: intransitive , originally only in military setting
definitions.dating_raw: from the end of the 17 c.

definitions.definition: To draw up in chapters , heads or articles; to enumerate , specify .
To draw up articles of agreement with; to propose term s, treat , bargain , parley .
To make conditions, stipulate , agree , formulate , conclude (upon something).

main_definition: ( intransitive , originally only in military setting ) To surrender on stipulated terms, end all resistance , give up , go along with or comply . [from the end of the 17 c.]
secondary_definitions: ( ambitransitive , obsolete ) To draw up in chapters , heads or articles; to enumerate , specify .
( transitive , obsolete ) To draw up articles of agreement with; to propose term s, treat , bargain , parley .
( transitive , obsolete ) To make conditions, stipulate , agree , formulate , conclude (upon something).
